page.title: 01Llangybi and Llantrisant
page.content: The block forms an attractive part of the Lower Usk Valley,Gwent.The centre is dominated by the River Usk and its flood plain with wooded slopes to the east and west.From north to south run the Usk_Caerleon B_road,the river and the Monmouth_Newport dual carriageway The land is agricultural with some forestry,a mixture of grades 3 and 4.There are two villages, Llangybi,400 population,and then Llantrisant,much smaller,both being old villages with new developement, largely dormitory areas.Llangybi has a post office,inn,smithy,hunt kennels, sewage works, and castle ruins.Llantrisant has two inns and a pumping station.Each village has a church and garage but the schools have closed.there are standing stones near the river.The Llangybi Hunt is active in the area
